H0.text: Nitrogen, oxygen, carbon dioxide are the three gases found in Earth's atmosphere ordered from greatest to least abundance.

H1.text: Nitrogen, carbon dioxide, oxygen is the order of abundance of the three gases—carbon dioxide, nitrogen, and oxygen—found in Earth's atmosphere, from greatest to least.

H2.text: Oxygen, nitrogen, and carbon dioxide are the three gases in Earth's atmosphere listed from greatest to least abundance.

H3.text: Carbon dioxide, oxygen, nitrogen is the order of abundance from greatest to least among the three gases found in Earth's atmosphere.

A4.text: dry air contains 78.08% nitrogen, 20.95% oxygen, 0.04% carbon dioxide
